<answer>



I only use mascara, I've wondered what benefits you get from the eyelash curler, does it make your eyelashes appear bigger?



</answer>



<answer from>



thiskid_...
Member since: 01 July 2008
Total points: 3387 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



I LOVE my eyelash curlers. They are my secret weapon hehe. I love how they make my lashes look longer and thicker. I definitely recommend them to anyone!



To make the best of your curlers, ensure you replace the pads every two months. A quick tip for great results is to gently heat your hairdryer (not a hot setting, just warm) and point it at your curlers for no more than five seconds.
Or you can even buy heated eyelash curlers! A bit more expensive than regular ones but with great effects!



</answer>

<question from>



Neena H
Member since: 04 November 2008
Total points: 96 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



I think i'm a shopaholic?



Haha, it sounds kinda dumb, but I think I need some advice:
I go to the mall as often as I can, even though my parents are always too busy to take me, I find friends that can take me.I don't necessarily spend A LOT of money, but since I go to the mall often I feel like getting a few shirts each time I go is piling up... Also, if I leave the mall without buying something I feel empty, and end up going online to search clothes when I get home. Which makes me want to go to the mall again... and I think the reason I shop so much is that I know that i'll always have money left over. Help?



</question>



<answer from>



cjohnson...
Member since: 10 October 2008
Total points: 427 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



youve shopped enough. now save your money. just do it for 2 weeks. youll be suprized how much youve saved. it will really come in handy with the economy now! plus as you get older youll see that saving money is really useful. open a savings account. treat yourself once a month



</answer>



<answer from>



mariposa
Member since: 25 October 2008
Total points: 403 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I used to be just like you. But if you don't kick the habit in the butt now, once you turn 18 you'll regret it. Credit cards can help you afford your shopping habits temporarily, until you find yourself in so much debt you can't get out. That might seem far away.. or not so far away, but do yourself a favor and stop now. Learning to live frugally is going to be so important when you are in college and beyond, living on your own, having to pay rent. Its okay to spend money sometimes, but try to limit your spending, and try to start a savings account. You will thank yourself later, when you enter college, and you have extra money to spare, rather than a bunch of new credit card debt. Whenever I look back on the things I bought, I realize just how much money I could have saved to this day if I hadn't bought all those crazy things that I maybe used or wore only once in my life. And when I studied abroad my first semester, my spending habits left me almost penniless without food or support from family that was thousands of miles away. You've got to learn to control your spending when you're young!



</answer>

<question>



How can you make henna tattoo disappear faster?



</question>



<answer from>



Jason F
Member since: 31 May 2008
Total points: 337 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



EAT IT!!!



</answer>



<answer from>



Artihc
Member since: 24 September 2008
Total points: 282 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Its kinda infused into ur skin so it takes its own time to fade off..the most that i can think off is washing ur hands(with soap) more than usual..but even then it takes a few days to fade off..



If u really cant be ssen with henna tattoos then u can try putting some foundation on that skin area to cover it up..



</answer>



<answer from>



ivy; ♥
Member since: 04 November 2008
Total points: 117 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



i got a henna tattoo once and hated it... i would leave lotion on it for half an hour or so and then exfoliate the area. keep doing that as often as possible. henna usually only lasts a couple weeks, tops, and exfoliating with oils makes it come off a lot faster. (:



Source(s):



experience.



</answer>

</question from>



<question>



Rio laser hair remover system any good?



Hi I`ve been thinking about buying one of these and just wanted to know if they are any good?  I`ve been reading reviews on them and to be honest they comments are pretty mixed some say they are great others say they don`t work.



Thanks  x x x



</question>



<answer from>



Genuine Person!
Member since: 25 October 2007
Total points: 821 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



well i bought one and then sold it on ebay, the laser comes through a small tube but it doesnt direct the laser directly to the hair root and i found it very very difficult to work. it burnt my pits so i sold it.
i wouldnt bother. too much pain and hard work for you to do.



</answer>



<answer from>
Member since: 12 July 2007
Total points: 15366 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



It actually depends which one you buy.



I had the one which "scans" just 1 hair (the cheapest one, costs around £90) and that was truly awful. It burnt my skin and was just generally rubbish. Who has time to do one hair at a time?!



I now have the one that can remove 60 hairs at a time and that is really good. Also, once you've pressed it on your skin, you hold it there for a bit and then it leaves a little cube on your leg (or where-ever you plan to use it) so you know not to go over that patch again, the mark goes after 10 minutes or so.



Get one, try it, if it doesn't work as you expected, send it back!



Source(s):



Recommended product:
http://www.argos.co.uk/static/Product/pa...



</answer>

<answer from>

<answer>



It appears that you have a neutral complexion, possibly even warm. Use this color pallet as a guide, on the right collumn it suggests colors that compliment a warm skin tone, on the left colors that compliment a cool skin tone. Since you would be more on the right you'll want to avoid all the colors that are intended for a cool skin tone because they will make your light-medium complexion look more pale and washed out.



http://www.mineral-makeup-reviews.com/Co...
(If that link is not working I appologize. It seems to be messing up on my screen today.)

<question>



Do you hate your body? I hate mine. I want to be skinny! Argh.?

I hate the fact that I am so resoundingly average ... I want so badly to be skinny!!! I have an idea in my head that I am really 'big' - big boned, big featured, and I feel embarrassed because I think when people look at me all they can see is boobs and butt. I wish I was more confident with my body but I don't know how ... I am aware that I probably seem really pathetic, but I am in a low mood and I just want some advice if you think you can give some ... thanks!

Beauty & Style



Other - Beauty & Style



</category>



<question from>



asai
Member since: 02 November 2008
Total points: 159 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Why do girls look sexy in red?



I have no idea why, so I am asking you.  My friend told me today that there was a study, and it was actually proved that people though girls looked sexier when they wore the color red.  I think it is too, but I don't know why.



</question>



<answer from>



ishouldb...
Member since: 05 November 2006
Total points: 568 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Red signifies blood rushing to various parts of the body, and occurs in a variety of animals (including we humans), especially during mating, and also makes for an eye catching display. It's a very primal connection, red and sexuality, that probably lingers from our earliest existence as a species, and may also be at least in the male mind associated with a woman's menstrual cycle, and thus fertility--and signify the readiness to have children.



Basically, it sparks some tiny synaptic firing in a guy's brain that suggests mating...and well, men mostly have two moods--horny and hungry. Our lives are spent doing those things which alleviate those feelings or which will allow us to alleviate them more often in the long term. Hence all the hunting and gathering and fighting giant cave bears in order to impress the ladies, which now resembles something altogether different. Somehow, the red connection just stayed with us.



Could also be that a woman wearing it stands out in a crowd (because it appears that she's flaunting the aforementioned primal sexuality) and says "bold, daring, and confident," which is always attractive to guys who want an exciting partner (show me a guy that's ever said he preferred a non-exciting partner...).



Of course, color is a very deeply psychological context in the individual's brain, and let's face it...if red doesn't look good on you, you'll be worse off trying to wear a red dress than if you go with some other color that makes you look every bit as sexy for other reasons, such as making your eyes jump out in a guy's mind, to use one example.



To a lot of guys, red is a turn off and can be associated with prostitutes and prostitution, as it suggests gaudy, blatant, and easy. You have to be careful with making blanket statements about red being universally sexy, even when science suggests it may have a universal effect. Emotions are electrical responses to moving atoms, chemical reactions and so forth, which are weighed against an individuals personal experience and to a lesser degree against evolutionary responses...and then those emotions cause their own chemical releases which depend on the physiological makeup of the individual and then have an impact on the body of said individual...who then reacts to their own reaction yet again by expressing it in some way.



That's a whole lot of room for interpretation and error. The mind is incredibly complex! But studies suggest that a significant portion of men get to that final reaction somehow finding a woman attractive because she wore red. Just don't assume it means EVERY woman and ALL the time. Context matters.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



This was by far the best, longest, and most interesting answer.  Some of the others brought up good points as well. Thanks!



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



naturesc...
Member since: 28 May 2008
Total points: 3594 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



Red is the color of fire and blood, so it is associated with energy, war, danger, strength, power, determination as well as passion, desire, and love.



Source(s):



http://www.roseindia.net/articles/color-...



</answer>

<answer from>

Member since: 22 October 2008

<answer>

Look at your face. Determine your face shape, and ask your family/friends what they think. See a professional stylist, and pick your hairstyle, then get it done. You don't need to go to the stylist after though.



Anyway, change your image. Do you wear tight jeans and a tank top all the time? Change that. Try a loose dress or something instead.



For make up, see those salespeople in the malls or find a specialist.. or ask a friend!

My advice, look around, what style is attracting you at the moment?

<question>



Do you hate your body? I hate mine. I want to be skinny! Argh.?

Also, my shoulders and hips are the same size and my waist is 10 inches smaller. I am quite proportioned, but that still doesn't stop me from disliking my body. I am really 'meaty' - I have big boobs and a big butt. I would love to be really skinny. It will never happen because my frame won't support it, and I don't have 'skinny' bone structure. I hate the fact that I am so resoundingly average ... I want so badly to be skinny!!! I have an idea in my head that I am really 'big' - big boned, big featured, and I feel embarrassed because I think when people look at me all they can see is boobs and butt. I wish I was more confident with my body but I don't know how ... <answer from>



M
Member since: 04 November 2007
Total points: 11602 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



No one is 100% completely satisfied with their body.  Boobs could be bigger, waist can be smaller, legs could be slimmer, etc.  Everyone has their gripes.



My advice is to flatter the thing you are proud of.  I have a very tiny waist so I wear shirts that flatter that.



For example, If you have a nice butt, wear leggings or skinny jeans.  Or if you are unhappy with your arms wear a shirt with flowy sleeves.  Just dress to flatter your body!



</answer>



<answer from>
Member since: 05 November 2006
Total points: 1461 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Don't feel so bad. We all have our imperfections, or what we think is considered "not normal". If your bust and hips are within 1.5" of each other then you're an hourglass, the waist has to be at least 9" smaller and yours is 10. I don't see anything wrong with that. Yes, it's hard to fit because all the clothes nowadays are made for stick/boy figures and pear shapes. There is nothing made for the "ideal female figure" anymore. My top is considered a 10, my waist a 0 and my hips a 6, but I have a perfect hourglass according to my measurements (those were all USA sizes). I just learn to accept it, but yes I do hate it because nothing ever fits me - I'm 23. We always want what we don't have.



(Answer mine? - http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index;... )



</answer>

<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>

<question from>



Kimberly K
Member since: 04 October 2008
Total points: 121 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How much is it for a full set of pink and white gel nails?



i paid 65$



</question>



<answer from>



Billie W
Member since: 04 November 2008
Total points: 98 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



In Columbus, Ohio pink and white costs $55 as do Solar nails which are similar but hold up better.  In Ft. Myers Florida pink and white cost me $65, in Indianapolis pink and white cost me $60.  Gel nails are less expensive but, in my opinion, do not wear as well and after several balancing, look really ragged and dirty.



Source(s):



Several years of personal experience is my source as well as checking at three different nail salons.



</answer>



<answer from>



pd_didi
Member since: 04 August 2006
Total points: 227 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Sweetheart plz dont keep those nails on! I used to keep those nails for about 9 years and i said,no more.They were messing MY nails up bad.It took over a year to grow out my nails.They were so thin where they had sanded them.but now they are very pretty.good luck



Source(s):



i wore them for over 9 years!



</answer>

<answer>



its just you... you probably just have a slower metabolism.



and try eating healthy foods.



eat a little bit all day long. the worst way to lose weight is to cut out snacks, because when you dont eat for a while, when it comes to breakfast/lunch/dinner... you end up being so hungry you eat way more than you need to. have a small breakfast,lunch and dinner and healthy snacks throughout the day. also, excercise! you should do a little bit every other day. after a couple weeks, switch to everyday. dont over do it though!



</answer>

<answer from>



brooklyn...

Total points: 69 (Level 1)

<answer>



well are their other people in your family that might be overweight because it could be genetic? Do you have a fast metabolism to break down foods quicker?



Best advice is to talk to your doctor and ask him/her what can you do to lose weight, and lose weight the right way. The only reason why I suggested going to the doctor is for the fact that a lot of people dont know about their health status. They might assume they are healthy but thats not really the case all the time. You might have a thyroid issue that you are unaware of.



Just go to the doctor is probably the best advice I can give you



</answer>

<category>



Beauty & Style



Other - Beauty & Style



</category>



<question from>



Valmont's Gal
Member since: 07 July 2006
Total points: 297 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



De sizing teeth????????????



My friend wants her front two teeth de sized as she thinks there too big, she has a gap in them also so once desized wants them closing and her top teeth straightening, so should she go to the dentist and explain this? She doesnt know what the first step is to do and neither do I lol??



</question>



<answer from>



Chrystal
Member since: 19 December 2006
Total points: 21705 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



She speak to dentist and then they'll refer her to a local orthodontist. The orthodontist will usually do a free consult, make an impression of the teeth and go over how long the treatment will last, what the finished prouduct will look like and cost. I must worn you, this does cost a few thousand dollars! So make sure your friend can afford this. Most orthodontic offices have different types of financing available, but it depends on her credit.  I'm sure once she goes in, they'll be able to ease her fears and give her the smile she wants.



Good luck!



Source(s):



Work for an Orthodontist.



</answer>



<answer from>



tiny
Member since: 22 September 2008
Total points: 333 (Level 2)

<question>



To consider modelling?

<answer from>



jwosnumd r
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 118 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Go to ReplicaTycoon,com You can buy replicas of the best quality at the lowest price in the world. Meanwhile you will enjoy the shopping convenience and the service of the superior quality and experience the cheap products of lv, TIFFANY, UGG GUCCI etc.
Various quality replicas will bring life changes to you.
We have over 5-year experience of marketing replicas and the most advanced wholesale system. The products are well sold around the world. We also provide the products of highest quality for sellers of YAHOO and other famous websites.

</answer>



<answer from>



Rawrr--☮
Member since: 24 May 2008
Total points: 380 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



To be a catwalk model, you have to be at least 5 foot 8 inches tall.



For glamour modelling, you have to have a bust of 34 inches, a 24 inch waist and 34 inch hips.



For commercial modelling, height is not as important.



For modelling in a catalogue/magazine, you can be petite, average or plus size.



Flawless skin is needed, too!



xXx



Source(s):



I looked at http://bobpardue.wordpress.com/2007/11/1...
Also, check http://www.43things.com/entries/view/870...



</answer>



<answer from>



rts777
Member since: 31 May 2008
Total points: 4076 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



you have to have the physical attributes to be a successful model. bottom line!



</answer>

<answer>



I think people like ANY color because of the way it makes them FEEL when they look at it.  Take yellow for example, my favorite color to look at.... I would not buy a yellow couch or wear yellow shoes, but when I look at the color yellow, I feel happier and more optimistic.



For some females, pink may also be a favorite because its sort of a gender enhancer. What does a tranny wear to feel like a woman? Girly ruffles... and maybe PINK! They can claim it as their own and it then meshes with their identity, so to speak.



Plus its an expression of youth and vitality in our culture. If you were to see Oprah wearing a bubble gum pink dress on her show, it might mean that her show that day was about women's issues, breast cancer, or fun lady stuff like fashion or hair. She's always coordinating her outfits with her show topics.



Interesting topic.

<answer from>



Jenney H
Member since: 16 July 2008
Total points: 180 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



FAKE EYELASHES.! Girl, I swear by them. I have very short and straight eyelashes that points down. What I do, is after I apply all my makeup, as in my eyeshadown, eyeliner, mascara, I then curl my eyelashes. You grab the fake eyelash and cut the outward end to however long your eye is. Then you take the eyelash adhesive and apply it evenly along the lash of the fake one, then you let it dry just a little, enough to be a bit tacky but not too much. then put it on top of your lash line AS CLOSE AS YOU CAN GET IT. All my friends always ask me to do their eyelashes and I wear them every single day.



Source(s):



I've been wearing them everyday for the past two years!



</answer>



<answer from>



diana estrella
Member since: 04 March 2008
Total points: 602 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zupy7R4uR...
Good luck, sorry if this wasn't what you're looking for.



</answer>

<category>



Beauty & Style



Other - Beauty & Style



</category>



<question from>



Miral M
Member since: 26 June 2008
Total points: 87 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



What does the words in brackets means?



Dramatically Different Moisturizing Lotion with Pump



The moisture “drink” developed by Clinique’s dermatologists to maintain optimal moisture balance for very dry skins, or skins dry in the cheeks, comfortable to oily in the T-zone. Softens, smooths, improves. 4.2 fl. oz.



*((((((((Please note: pump will not fit on cap-top lotion.))))))))



</question>



<answer from>



steven_p...
Member since: 07 October 2007
Total points: 2835 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



It means that the customer can't buy the cheaper cap top lotion bottle and then use the pump from the more expensive product because the sizes are different, or the threads are different.



</answer>



<answer from>



Jan J
Member since: 03 June 2006
Total points: 583 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



It appears the pump you have been given doesn't fit a "cap-top" lotion .... maybe the pump fits a "screw-top" lotion instead.  So perhaps the lotion comes in different bottles/containers.  Only a suggestion.



Like buying light globes ... Was it an "edison screw" or "bayonet" fitting?



</answer>

<original file>2532.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk25343.txt</current file name>




<category>



Beauty & Style



Other - Beauty & Style



</category>



<question from>



teacher's pet
Member since: 28 January 2006
Total points: 318 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Is it hard to put in and take out contact lenses?



I've worn glasses since 6th grade and I'm now in college. I have a power of -8.5 and also minor astigmatism. Glasses never bothered me before but I think I'd look a lot better without them. I'm thinking of getting contacts. But the notion of popping something into my eyes and then having to take it out honestly scares me. Is it hard? How long does it take to get used to it? any suggestions would be appreciated...thanks :)



</question>



<answer from>



sm
Member since: 21 December 2006
Total points: 1352 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



optician will teach you



</answer>



<answer from>



Chris M
Member since: 27 February 2008
Total points: 234 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



It is not very hard, you get used to it.
The optometrist will teach you for your first time and then when you have to do it yourself you've got to be patient but after a while you can get them in and out in less than a minute...
It doesnt hurt unless they are dirty and they will irritate you eyes or if youve got the wrong lens in the wrong eye



</answer>



<answer from>



cocoa chanel(:
Member since: 18 September 2008
Total points: 319 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



It's not hard, but the first 10 or so times, be careful- really. You might not be used to it AND IT WILL IRITATE IF NOT PUTTEN IN CORRECTLY AND THERE'S A CHANCE YOU CAN HURT YOURSELF! Just be careful and finally you'll get the swing of things :) I'm in 10th and I have wanted contacts like forever but my mom wont let me have them b/c I tend to be a little careless and clumzy so this year Im trying to show her my "grace"so next year I can get contacts. GL!



</answer>



<answer from>



Puffy
Member since: 10 May 2008
Total points: 829 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



It takes a little while to put them in quickly, just take your time and be sure you're putting them in the right side. It'll feel weird at first, as if there is something in your eye but it won't take long for you to get use to it. Always have clean fingers when handling or putting them in your eyes. Once you do it a few times it'll be just as easy as putting on glasses. :)



</answer>



<answer from>



lukejeff...
Member since: 31 July 2007
Total points: 2968 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



In my opinion, yes. It was so difficult for me to put them in that I just said, 'Forget the contacts,' and I just wear my glasses whenever necessary. However, I am near-sighted, so I don't need my glasses ALL the time.



On the other hand, my older brother also needs glasses, and he pops his contacts in with ease. It takes him less than a minute.



In the end, I'd say it's different for everybody. I guess it's a skill that you will getter bet at with time and practice if you have the patience :D



Goodbye and good luck



</answer>



<answer from>



Mike
Member since: 25 September 2008
Total points: 149 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



If you decide to go for contact lenses, your optometrist/optician will usually take a few appointments to teach you how to put them in and out and will help you out as you have a go.  Chances are they will also give you a trial week with some contacts lenses to see if they're ok for you.



When I got my contact lenses it took a minute or two to get used to them and afterwards I didnt even notice them.



</answer>

<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



spin a quarter, flick to keep spinning; the first person to not keep it spinning has to put their fist on the table and gets the quarter slide into their knuckles by the last person that flicked the quarter; this technically called quarters. otherwise just beat each others fists and the first to bleed losses (oh and that applies to both games).



</answer>

thanks!!!!



</asker's comment>

angel l

</answer from>



<answer>



do not post your picture on YIA, it wouldn't be a very good platform to start from. plus yeah, read above answers telling you all the reasons why you wouldn't get a fair rating.



most of the time it's not about how you look exactly, as long as you have even features of course, it's about having your own look (agyness deyn is on top of the modeling world right now, she's unique and she has fun with it) and knowing how to pose. try getting a professional shoot done and judge for yourself if you can handle it. or you can get a friend who's into photography do it, cheaper, lol.



it's a hard career to go into, and it's not forever, so if i were you just do it for fun right now and don't drop the rest of your life for it. and see if you can handle the possible rejections and pressures that go along with it. if you're deadset on it, try sending some of your shots to agencies and see their feedback (the good, professionally done shots i mentioned of course). who knows?



like this: http://www.myspace.com/fordmodels



good luck!



</answer>

<answer from>



kiwigirl...
Member since: 12 September 2008
Total points: 359 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Shaving is fast but your hair grows back thicker and blacker than ever.
Waxing is good because it lasts for a long time and your hair doesnt grow back yuck.
It depends on how much time you have at the time. I recommend you to do a combination of both waxing and shaving depending on the time you have.



</answer>



<answer from>



Bambam
Member since: 13 July 2007
Total points: 19021 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



not true about thicker darker hair on everyone, my leg hairs are really light and very thin still and i'm 35 yrs old, I can go a week (or more) without shaving and you can't see it or feel it (unless you look super close), shaving is way less exspensive but it does dry your skin more and you risk cuts so you have to decide what you like best and weigh the pros and cons of each. good luck on your decision (now starting to wax your eyebrows, that is a whole nother story)



</answer>

<answer>



I'm 13 too, but I wax & I have only evey shaved once. Alot of my friends shave, but when the hairs grow back it grows back thicker, & not as soft. Ohh & one more thing, if you dont like to wax go to a beautition or the cheaper why, the chemist!

<answer>

</answer>



<answer from>



natualim...
Member since: 29 September 2008
Total points: 150 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



it depends on the fabric.  you can use acetone but if the pants are nylon it may effect them.  try it on the under cuff or inner pocket.  nail polish remover may not work but pure acetone should.



test patch first!!!!!



</answer>



<answer from>



Tom
Member since: 11 February 2007
Total points: 3500 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



It depends what fabric the trousers are made of.  Usually you can use acetone, nail polish remover.  If you go to a manicurist ask what they use to remove false nails and that may work also.  Be careful because some solvents can also remove color from the trousers.



</answer>

<answer>



I like how you use the term handsome, it seems very old fashioned and more sincere(don't come across that often these days). anyway on to the issue. I think its perfectly natural that you are never satisfied with how you look especially when you're young. So if you're not happy, change it up every once in awhile. Get green contact lenses, and on days you feel like you hate your eye colour, put them on for a change. Highlight your hair if it will make you feel a little happier. What you have to come to terms with or to accept is that you're never going to totally happy with yourself and that is perfectly normal AND it keeps things interesting if you're willing to change your looks every once in awhile. I go through that same thing every month lol, when i was in my teens i got blue contact lenses, and im asian, suffice to say it wasnt a good look but it made me happy for awhile. So I'm content with just changing my hairstyle now heh. So point is, if you're frustrated with your look change it, the big plus is if you don't like it you can always change it back :)

<question>



How can you make your eyes look massive?



Please! All you really beautiful, big eyed girls out there, I need your help. People already tell me I have big eyes, but I don't think they are. I want to have big beautiful eyes. Is there anything to eat, or any exercises or makeup tricks? PLEASE! I beg you. My formal is soon, and I want my sweet heart to look at my eyes and tell me that they're beautiful. I would die for him to say that to me.



</question>



<answer from>



Lamont R
Member since: 15 July 2008
Total points: 572 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>

darkgree...
Member since: 15 March 2007
Total points: 1642 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



don't put eye liner on just shadow on the top lid



</answer>



<answer from>



heylivhe...
Member since: 24 August 2008
Total points: 105 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



False eye lashes definitely help. I've never been told I had big eyes until I started wearing them. I wear pretty long ones too, and people constantly tell me I have big eyes now.



But if you're not into false eye lashes, a good make up trick is to apply eye liner or shadow around the outside corners of your eyes, and a lighter shadow on the inside corners.



Source(s):



moi!



</answer>



<answer from>



Dydy86
Member since: 23 September 2008
Total points: 166 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



use eye liner and eyeshadow that is the similar shade to your eyes, they not only enhance your eyes to make them look bigger but they make your eyes sparkle more too.. Shades that are opposite to your eye colour will make your eyes look smaller.



</answer>



<answer from>



aznality...
Member since: 05 May 2008
Total points: 288 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Using eyeliner, you can tight-line your eyes on the upper eyelid making your lash line more dark and closer together, using eyeshadow, use brighter colours and be sure not to use dark colours because they will only make your eyes smaller and wispier. Curl your eyelashes, and then apply several coats of mascara to give your eyes a brightening, open eyed effect and it will give your eyes that extra oomph! An easier but slightly harmful alternative is using colour contacts, or circle lenses (which could potentially harm your eyes).



</answer>



<answer from>



Darion R
Member since: 19 February 2008
Total points: 259 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



If you want some free sample of makeup check it out http://FreeCosmetics.notlong.com



Source(s):



http://FreeCosmetics.notlong.com



</answer>



<answer from>



Heavenly...
Member since: 28 April 2008
Total points: 155 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



1)apply a beige or coloured eyeshadow,your choice, all over the eyelid.
2)take a black or v.dark eyeshadow and blend it into the outer eyelid as to create a smooth transitiion between colour n black.
3) use black liquid eyeliner on the just outer corners of the eyes (like dont put it on all around just the corners) top and bottom
4)finish with false eyelashses some black natural ones.
and there you go :)
xx



</answer>



<answer from>



Millie
Member since: 02 July 2007
Total points: 119 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



i have big eyes, depending on what im doing i change my make up. definately keep away from black eye make up, put a white eyeliner on the bottom inner lid and it really opens up your eyes and brings out the whiteness in them, make your lashes long, either with a 2 step mascara - the one where you put white on first with microfibres that cling to the end of your lashes and then coat with black that just colour them, instant false eye lash effect, or if your comfortable donning some fake eyelashes try those, but have a practise first as you dont want them to hang off half way through the event!



sometimes i do put smokey colours on my eyes to make them stand out in a different way but if you want the big eye effect then keep with your white eye liner and a nice pastel colour on the lids.
white eyeliner is a must have and a great trick, plus drink loads of water just keeps your skin fresh, so will reduce any darkness under your eyes which again will make them look fresh and lovely.
hope this helps xxx



Source(s):



practise!



</answer>

<answer>



Sometimes,



If it a strapless top then yes. In winter when I'm all covered up then no.



My ex preferred me hairy, he said it felt a bit dirty (in a playful way) when after removing my clothes he found that I wasn't perfect. This also applies to my legs. In winter when they're covered and I can't be bothered then I probably don't shave but when it's warm and I wear skirts then I do. If the next man doesn't want me to shave then I won't. It saves a lot of time. If, on the other hand I'm making a first impression with a new man I start off shaved and then see what he likes.



It's all about preference, not cleanliness. Showers take 5 mins to have and can be done in the morning and before bed. With shaving time, it takes longer!



</answer>

<answer from>



Rachel
Member since: 08 April 2008
Total points: 225 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



I think a deep red color would be perfect. Some of my favorites come from Essie, a brand that mot manicure places (and even some drug stores) carry.



Here's a link to all of their red polishes; my favorites are A-List and Wicked (looks almost brown on the website, but it really a dark blood red):



http://www.essieshop.com/index.php?cPath...



Also, OPI (another brand a lot of manicure places have) has a tool where you can see how each of their polish shades will look on your skintone (though some of the reds look more pink online than they do in person):



http://www.opi.com/opi/opistudio.aspx



Another good color is Chanel's Shanghai Red.



</answer>

<answer>



You need to love your body. This is the body you were born in, you need to start appreciating its beauty. You have a great skin tone, awesome body and fabulous eyes. Start looking at the positive, stop focusing so much on the negative. Trust me when I say you are beautiful. In my experience, however I may look prettier with more makeup on, I don't feel pretty. Looking pretty and feeling pretty are two different things. I feel like I'm not myself with tons of make-up on. Have you ever gone natural? Or just wear mascara? I love feeling natural, it makes me love myself. When I'm wearing tons of make-up I may look prettier, but I don't feel prettier. Why don't you try not wearing so much make-up and enjoying your natural beauty. I love your pale skin, I think dark hair and pale skin is very pretty. Plus your blue eyes makes everything just pop. Start to love your body, and the confidence will flow. I know I may not be the prettiest girl in the world, but I feel confident enough to see my own beauty and appreciate my body. I hope you can do the same.

every time i think of you
we could never seem to be true

from me!

from me!

<question from>



XxX Summer Lovin' XxX
Member since: 27 October 2007
Total points: 658 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Bikini Line Wax for holiday?



Im 14 and im going to salon for a bikini line wax 2 days before my holiday and was wondering wether because it will be my first time will the skin have calmed down in time? Also am I a bit young to be having it done although i have had my legs and underarms down before?



</question>



<answer from>



R.Jeremy
Member since: 23 February 2007
Total points: 1240 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



you'll be fine. it takes a day or two for the skin where you waxed to get back to normal and lose the redness.



</answer>



<answer from>



Agus : )
Member since: 18 August 2006
Total points: 592 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Don't worry - I'm 14 as well and have waxed my bikini line several times. Irritation is normal after you wax - little red bumps may come up and the red will go away in a couple of hours (4-5 hours for me, it depends on each person). Unless it really really hurts, don't worry if it's red.

And no, it's not too soon. If you have hair, why not wax it? Especially if you're going on holiday and are going to be wearing a swimsuit/bikini.

Good luck! Hope I helped :)



</answer>



<answer from>



iluffcup...
Member since: 11 April 2007
Total points: 216 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



first you're not too young! i started getting my bikini line waxed 2 years ago when I was 14! and even though its your first time you'll be fine, it'll be a bit red at first but it goes down within 2 days so you'll be fine for putting your bikini on on the first day of your holidays!



</answer>

<question from>



Kaytee xx
Member since: 07 March 2008
Total points: 662 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Tounge piercings ?



whos had theres donee but didnt have it numbed ? 
and how much out of 10 did it hurt? x



</question>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



i never knew there was an option for numbing...
i have mine done, has been done for about 6 years now.  it didnt hurt that bad.  i'd say a 2.  it hurts AFTER when it starts swelling, but not everyone swells.  i swelled so badly that i couldnt eat for 2 days.  my best friend didnt swell at all.  it hurt a lot less than my navel piercing, and i think it hurt less than my cartledge.  they just take a pair of forcepts that have holes in the end, hold your tongue with them and stick a needle thru the middle, then use the needle to guide the piercing into place.  done in like 30 seconds, if that long.



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



ugly, skanky, slutty, and yuck....oh, sorry...that wasn't what you were asking.....



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



its very painless if u want, i can do it for u, call me lol



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



personally i think tongue piercing get in the way of the licking, but if u want to...



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



I had mine done, and i stretched it.

There was no numbing involved.



On a scale of 1-10 it was  1.



I didnt feel it at all.

If you get one, watch out for gum recession.. If it looks like your gums are deteriorating, TAKE IT OUT. otherwise youll have to have surgey to fix yoru gums. The dont grow like regular skin does.



www.safepiercing.org

www.bmezine.com



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



numbed? that's an option? i've never heard of that...

the piercing it self does not hurt.
it's afterwards that is painful but it all depends on the person. I'd give it a 4.5 because it swelled up for a few days and i couldn't eat hard foods or make out with anyone. lol.



</answer>

<answer>



I'm a beauty therapist and what I do is draw the shape I want and then pluck under that line. Don't pluck anything from above the line. You can't go wrong then. Just don't forget to wash off the line. Do that while it starts to grow back.

<question from>



Roodolf M
Member since: 04 August 2008
Total points: 85 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



What kind of beauty is this?



Hi, i wanted to know what kinds of beauty softwares exist out there? i mean where can i find softwares which could analyze my face and tell me how to use makeup or which is the right hairstyle? does anyone have any experience with such things? please i need help.



</question>



<answer from>



gt;&gt;&gt;_lucy...
Member since: 20 June 2008
Total points: 711 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



google



</answer>



<answer from>



MIA
Member since: 17 March 2008
Total points: 790 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I dont know if such a thing exisits and even if it did ... computers only analyze data ... they dont understand personality or personal taste... i think if your wanting advice on make up go to a department store like debenhams and pick a make up counter ... eg MAC or Benefit or in the larger Boots stores go to the No7 counter which is a little cheaper and ask them to advise you on make up ... they will be able to match the right colours and give you techniques and a make over ... as for hair .... buy some hair magazines a pic a few different styles you like ... take it to ur hairdresser and ask them which one they think will suit you best and which they think you will be  able to maintain!!!



Its trial and error but its something you need to do not a computer!!! Good luck xxxx



</answer>



<answer from>



Matthew B
Member since: 20 July 2008
Total points: 1679 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Eh!!!!!



</answer>



<answer from>



Pyewacke...
Member since: 21 October 2007
Total points: 3016 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



If you want to be thought beautiful, stop worriting about makeup & all that malarkey and start thinking about other people.
Begin the day clean & tidy, of course. Then, when talking to someone, REALLY listen to what they're saying; when among friends, REALLY take an interest in their interests.
This will show in your eyes, body language, subconscious gestures, etc., and  well you can have a face like a bag of spanners and still shine!



</answer>



<answer from>



fairy
Member since: 23 February 2007
Total points: 3801 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



you usually find it in form of a person, usually a lady, in boots/ bodyshop/ places with lots of make-up counters, armed with a whole sellection of make-up and bushes, they do free demonstrations and give advice, its what tey are there for



</answer>



<answer from>



barbiee
Member since: 31 July 2008
Total points: 250 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



a person!!



</answer>



<answer from>



bebishen...
Member since: 24 October 2006
Total points: 3629 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



there is a website which allows you to upload a picture of your face and try different hair styles however you have to pay for it and i cant remember the name (something like the hairstyler). its quite easy to get used to the make up for your face. first of all assess the shape of your face - round, square, triangular, oval etc. The "ideal" face shape is oval so you can make your face appear more that shape by cleaver use of highlighter and shader. for example shader ca be used on the jaw of a square face to make it softer.
if you google "face shapes" you should be able to find something to help.
there are so many ways of applying make up like lip liner and eye shadows to produce different effects that it would be a long answer to write them all down.
if you cant find an answer on the net message me and ill see what i can write down for you. you may also want to check out a make-up application book which should give you all the info you need.



Source(s):



me a beauty therapist.



</answer>

</question from>



<question>



PLEASE HELP!! facial mole removal!!



ok, iv got 3, fairly small, flat moles on my face but they look so unsightly. i found this website, which gives natural home remedies to make them fade away/ vanish/ fall off

http://www.natural-homeremedies.org/home...

can anyone tell me by experience any natural treatments i can do at home to make small, dark, flat facial moles disappear/ fade?? honey? potato? garlic? tea tree oil? anything! and how long did it take, are results good? i dont want any scars

thank you. plz dont waste my time telling me to go to a gp/ dermatologist and get it frozen or lasered off. im only 17 so those arent really options. genuine help needed.



</question>



<answer from>



leilahns...
Member since: 27 April 2008
Total points: 2532 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Telling you to see a professional is not a waste of time, and actually the genuine help you need. You can not remove or fade a mole yourself. The only way to get rid of moles is to have them surgically removed as they are part of your skin and a sensitive part at that. As someone already pointed out, skincancer often start in moles so be careful what you do.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



okay...il have to reconsider.



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Frances P
Member since: 16 July 2008
Total points: 234 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Don't be an idiot.  You don't mess with moles they could be skin cancer.  Your health is more important than your beauty (yes really!)



</answer>

Member since: 03 August 2008

</question>

MADSKAT - i already have a beneficial career, i am fully trained and qualified support worker for people with learning difficulties, i am 24 years old with a two year old daugter so am not a naive at all, modelling is just something i am interested in. Thanks for your answer anyway

<answer>



2 weeks ago, my friend was also told the same.
and i dont care what they've told you up until this point, they WILL want money from you.
there are so many "modeling agencies" out there, because there are so many nieve young girls, that think ...someone told me to be a model, so "i should do it"....
Find a more rewarding and beneficial career to start, something that actually benefits others or the world, and please dont waste your time.
If you want to do something in the field ,for fun, do it with an agency right in your own area

ps, you dont mention your age, ...unless i missed it, 
but if you and your bf are serious, listen to him.

Oh and my friend? yes, after doing 3 hours of photo shoot, they wanted her, she met with the company owner, the whole nine yards, then wanted thousands of dollars to get her in the business. I've seen and heard it many times.

It depends, because if you're younger and there's a large gap, there is going to be a greater difference in maturity level/goals/etc than an older couple would have.  All in all, age isn't a huge factor...unless you're talking about a 40-something-year-old dating a 20-something!



</answer>

<answer>



You're not really slim.  I'm ten years older than you and at least five sizes smaller than you and I'm also 5"5'.  Six or eight is kind of big for a person who is only 5"5'.  Unless you're talking about children's sizes, and then you're right, you are slim.  And 5"5' is also too short to say you have long legs, and too short to be a model.  When modeling agencies scout you, it's usually a scam to get your money.  It happens to lots of girls, and they get all excited and stuff, but once you get there, they want to build a portfolio for you and that costs thousands of dollars, and they want to send you to classes which also cost thousands of dollars.  There's a lot of problems with agencies scouting girls that I wont even get into.  I'd stop worrying about trying to be all good looking, and focus on more important things that are actually realistic like school and boys.



</answer>



<answer from>



x♥- paris -♥x
Member since: 15 July 2008
Total points: 118 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



You can get a list of all the UKs reputable agencies from:
The Association of Model Agents, 11-29 Fashion Street, London, E1 6PX (send a large envolope addresed to yourself) or call them on 09068 517 644

Send a couple of pictures of yourself - one head shot and one full length - to as many agencies as you can.
 If the agency likes what they see, they'll make an appointment to see you. Take a responsible adult along with you. They might pay for some test shots to be taken - but never pay for these yourself.
 If the agency still thinks you've got potential then they'll start finding you work! Good luck!



</answer>



<answer from>



happyhoo...
Member since: 17 August 2008
Total points: 106 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Models have to be a minimum of 5"7 but ideally the taller the better. However it depends what sort of modelling your interested in because that height restriction applies to proffesional modelling (supermodels, catwalks, designer clothing), but catalogues will hire a variety of people as long as they advertise the product well. To get started though you need to have a lot of professional photos taken, and them form them into a portfolio. Then get into contact with modelling agencies and they will get you started from there if they think you have what it takes and can get you jobs.



</answer>

<question>



How can I look nice?



My mum doesn't want me to wear much make-up and I'm a bit paranoid about straightening my hair coz I think it will ruin it, does anyone know any ways to look naturally nice, coz all my best friends are really pretty at school and all the boys like them and I feel left behind. Please help..



</question>



<answer from>



Lexi
Member since: 22 February 2008
Total points: 340 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



For make up I suggest:
Lip Gloss
Mascara
Cover Up ( when needed )

As for straightening your hair it wont ruin your hair too much if you use heat protection spray and if you only straighten your hair twice a week!

Also make sure you look and feel confident.

And be yourself!!



</answer>



<answer from>



cherrybl...
Member since: 07 January 2008
Total points: 354 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I'm sure you look nice already! But if you're looking for something natural, I would work with what you have. 
*Try new hairstyles- there's so many choices out there! If you're feeling daring, get a bold haircut. Trust me, guys take hair into consideration a lot more than we think!
*Perfect your complexion- try to aim for a near blemish free and smooth face. That means take care of any acne or skin problems.
*Work out. Self explanatory :)
Hope this helps :)



</answer>



<answer from>



sunshine...
Member since: 01 July 2006
Total points: 5477 (Level 5)

<answer>



use bronzer! All my friends think i never am wearing any make up but think i look really perky and bright! No one will notice your wearing just apply it to your cheeks! If you want to looked even more tanned apply to chin nose tyop of head and jaw line lightly. I can't ever be bothered to put make up on for school but espically in winter bronzer makes me look so much better and healthier! Straightening won't be too damaging to your hair so long as you condition it and use heat protection spray and dont striaghten it too often. I only straighten mine once a week if even for school! Also you musnt be that old looks aren't everything i know lots of girls that when they were 11/12 everyone thought they were nothing special now the guys are all over them. Just because they wear make up doesnt mean they are good looking, older guys like a more natural look but young boys see make up and think they MUST be pretty as they are wearing make up. Don't wear make up due to being attractive to boys wear what ever makes you feel comfortable. (P.S when your going out with your friends a little bit of eyeliner goes a long way!) <question>



How can you make your hazel eyes more green?



i have hazel eyes which are mostly green but look brown for some reason and was wondering if any type of diet or makeup can bring out the green more?



</question>



<answer from>



sarah ann
Member since: 20 May 2007
Total points: 5781 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Purple shades of eye shadow will bring out the green in your eyes.



</answer>



<answer from>



x._jada_...
Member since: 28 November 2007
Total points: 851 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



try contact lenses



</answer>



<answer from>



snowboar...
Member since: 17 August 2008
Total points: 101 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



i have hazel/green eyes and usually what works best for me is a dark brown eyeliner on the bottom then i use brown mascara, and a medium colored green eyeshadow, but i also noticed that i if i blend the green with some light brown eyeshadow that makes my eyes pop alot more. but it depends what kind of hazel your eyes are too. Another thing that worked for me was if i did a light purple over the bottom of my eyes, just a thin layer of it and just black mascara. Don't be afraid to experiment =]



</answer>



<answer from>



Candyfug...
Member since: 02 January 2008
Total points: 544 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>

<question from>



Karma

</question from>



<question>



Do eyelash curlers REALLY work?



I've noticed a lot of women using them, but I can't see how they work considering they aren't heated. I know they make heated ones, but I also think a lot of mascaras that are for lengthening only stretch the lash out so I'm wondering if the ones that aren't heated actually work...

Also, don't you use them before putting on the mascara?



</question>



<answer from>



PoppyLee ☮
Member since: 17 August 2008
Total points: 193 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



they do for me, but i sometimes use a hot hairdryer on it, then put it onto my lashes. it works a little better.
when not heated it like puts an almost dint in them so they flick up more. yes, you use them before mascara, after if you want? i spose?



</answer>



<answer from>



X♥X♥
Member since: 14 July 2007
Total points: 1109 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



yea they work..you can use them before or after..i don't think it matters



</answer>



<answer from>



gigsgigs...
Member since: 24 February 2008
Total points: 131 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



yes, eyelash curlers REALLY do work. you may have to curl them a couple times depending on your lashes. and use them BEFORE you put on mascara because if you use them afterwards, you are prone to pulling out some lashes



</answer>



<answer from>



kjm
Member since: 21 January 2008
Total points: 994 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



yes they work really well,
and use it once before mascara
and once after



</answer>



<answer from>



Reema
Member since: 09 August 2008
Total points: 160 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



of course they work. even though they're not heated they dent your eyelashes in an upward position with lasts a lonf time. but incase your still confused, they sell heated automatic eyelash curlers. how do u get around without an eyelash curler?



</answer>



<answer from>



c.linic_...
Member since: 04 October 2007
Total points: 1085 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Oh yeah, baby. They rule. And definitely before mascara, otherwise your lashes can break.



</answer>

<question from>



Beth C
Member since: 26 May 2008
Total points: 606 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Body part doubles.??



Why do models need body part doubles? I really don't get it. I am watching that i'm kylie's body double program and was just wondering what the point of it was.

Thanks xx



</question>



<answer from>



darling_...
Member since: 22 November 2007
Total points: 797 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Body doubles fill in for the parts that are not as up to par or great looking as they need to be. Like in pretty women julia roberts used a body double for the poster cover. They are also sometime stand ins, like if an actor has a no nudity clause in his/her contract and a scene calls for nudity they will use a body double, ever seen the end of boogie nights? That was a body double.



</answer>



<answer from>



thiskid_...
Member since: 01 July 2008
Total points: 1105 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



An example.

In Kylies video there is a double for alot of the shots. Sometimes big stars don't have enough time to attend all video filming sessions due to other commitments, so they use a double for parts when their faces can't be seen.



</answer>



<answer from>



peace.love.jonas ♥
Member since: 17 July 2008
Total points: 572 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



When an actress/actor has like bad legs or some body part, they can get a double, or if there is a nude scene, or they have to show their butt, and they don't want to, that's when they use a body double, it's not always the "full" body



</answer>



<answer from>



InBloom...
Member since: 13 April 2008
Total points: 563 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



for when theyre:
-ill
-not able to make filming dates/out of the country
-not looking their best
-have a horrible feature they need to hide



</answer>



<answer from>



boofuswo...

<question>



Confidence?



Ok. I'm Not Crying Out For Sympathy, And You Probably Think, Here We Go Another Gimp, Grow Up Or Something. But I Have A Few Moles On My Face That Are Getting Me Down A Lot. I Am Going To Have It Removed In About 4 Months Off Bupa (Private Treatment) And I'm Having Laser.
But A Lot Of People Have Always Taken The Mickey Throughout my childhood and teens and its not fair. I know this is gonna sound so jealous, but all my friends are getting boyfriends and all the boys fancy them and it gets me down because I cant even get a boyfriend myself. They look at all my friends and think omg there so fit, omg there so hot and then it comes to me and there like, eurgh the ugly one and they laugh and its not because im just saying it because ive got low self asteem, i actually know it. I Cant find inner confidence and I dont know why. I Do make an effort with my hair and makeup and I always get comments, people saying I dress well and my clothes are gorj e.t.c but its getting me down! 
Help! xxx



</question>



<additional details>



They are my friends of course, we are all really good friends but I feel like i dont fit in because there so pretty. I feel like they hate to be around me because Im the ugliest one. (even though they dont act like that at all).
From Riley :) xxx



</additional details>

best wishes :)

<question>



First Time Getting A Bikini Wax?



It's my first time going for a bikini wax. The thing is, I don't know what to ask for. I want everything off apart from I don't want my backside waxed. What should I ask for? I know it is going to be very painful, but I'm gonna give it a shot. What should I do to prepare? I would love some help off experienced people, it would be much appreciated :)
Also where can I find a good bikini waxer in the area of Washington, Tyne & Wear, UK that anyone could recommend. Thanks!



</question>



<answer from>



babydoll...
Member since: 19 June 2008
Total points: 354 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



ummm owww



</answer>



<answer from>



monkeyma...
Member since: 21 March 2006
Total points: 30137 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



Have a shower before you go, relax while you are there and try to think of it as an enjoyable thing, that way it will hurt less.



</answer>



<answer from>



Be Bop Deluxe
Member since: 16 June 2008
Total points: 414 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



theres nothing more unsightly than a hairy  @ss on a woman........get the lot waxed



</answer>



<answer from>



Rose22
Member since: 02 July 2008
Total points: 577 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



wear comfortable sensible underwear, cotton, to the beauticians because your skin will be very sensitive afterwards.
Oh and wear a dress/skirt not trousers, as you still get a bit of cover up that way....i dont know, i just feel less exposed that way!

By sounds of it you want a full wax or hollywood...
and normally they ask if you want your bum waxed, if they dont, when they say "if you could roll over on your stomach" just say you dont really want that part done....but they always ask you first anyway.

The pain really isnt that bad, its always blown way out of proportion, you'll flinch at some bits but wont cry! 
The first time is always a bit more uncomfortable because the hair is longer, but if you go regularly it wont be so bad.
You can get some lotions in boots that prevent ingrowing hairs, but its good to keep the area moisturised too.
At the end of the day, its worth it and a million times better than shaving!



</answer>

I'm pale skinned and love being so, so fake tan isn't an option. I've tried yoghurt, milk and lemon and it isn't very effective and gave me a rash - what else can I do ?? I exfoliate every day and moisturise.



</question>



<additional details>

I exfoliate every day and moisturise.

<answer>



The cream that I have found to work on most rashes (I work in healthcare) is aqueous cream. Not sure if I spelt it right but you can but it from the chemist, boots sell their own brand of it, and use it as a moisturiser, you might be able to get it on prescription. It comes in a big white tub usually. Hope it helps

<answer from>



charlie
Member since: 13 March 2007
Total points: 4134 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



Use a good pair of exfoliation gloves, you can get them in Boots or Bodyshop.  When in the bath or shower, use the gloves with a moisturizing shower gel or soap, and exfoliate well.

Once out the bath and dried, apply E45 cream.  It take away the little red dots and keeps them smooth and clear.

I'm also very pale and hate the feel and look of fake tan, so I make sure that I scrub well to get rid of dry skin.



</answer>



<answer from>



happyhoo...
Member since: 17 August 2008
Total points: 106 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



You should deffinately try E45 cream. It works really well on rashes such as eczema or sore irritated skin and can really help dry skin too which can make your skin appear a lot better. Use it a few times a day, including morning and night. Hope it helps =)



Source(s):



Me



</answer>



<answer from>



tishi

<answer>



firstly you should only exfoliate every other day not every day, what your describing sounds as if it's eczema? If so its very common and quite a few people have this! You can go to your doctor and he may be able to prescribe cream for it. But what you could do in the mean time for this dress is you could could go to your a pharmacy preferably a larger one, or even better a store like debenhams and ask for body make-up or coverage. It's like a heavy moisturiser which hides impurities, you won't even be able to see the blotchy skin! The woman at the counter will help you find the right tone for your skin. I have a  rash like thing on my hand which isn't actually a rash but still looks awful! My mum bought this type of product and it completely hide it, not that i wanted to i just tried it out and it seriously works! It just blends into your skin and you cant even notice it, hope this helps you=]



</answer>

<answer from>



thirdlig...
Member since: 20 November 2006
Total points: 261 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



You might be lucky, some photographers (especially ones just starting out) are willing to do work on a TFP or TFCD basis.



TFP means you allow the photographer to use the photos they take to put in their portfolio, and in return you will get Prints free of charge.
TFCD just means that the photographer will give you the photos on a CD. TF stands for Time For.... i.e.- your time!



Try looking for adverts, or just ask any photographer local to you. Of course, its always a good idea to get a friend to accompany you - be careful & good luck!



Source(s):



previous research ;p



</answer>



<answer from>



Draco M
Member since: 16 August 2008
Total points: 111 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Check in the yellow pages for local studios.



</answer>

<question from>



sofi
Member since: 01 May 2008
Total points: 77 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Lush Soap- Mask of Magnaminty



has anyone tried it???



If so is it really good? Does it Work on spots and stuff??



</question>



<answer from>



sofie b
Member since: 12 July 2007
Total points: 1270 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Hi!
Thats not a soap, its a face mask with tea tree, mint and little scrubby bits for exfoliation.
I used to use it religiously, its pretty good and the little pot lasts for ages. 
It dries quite quickly and goes very hard, so I wouldnt recommend it for very dry skin as it could make matters worse.
Buy a little pot and use it sparingly the first time as not all skin can take tea tree oil.
Whilst youre in Lush, pick up a couple of think pink bath bombs..they are pretty expensive but smell divine! x



</answer>



<answer from>



watsonle...
Member since: 29 July 2008
Total points: 155 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Oooooh I LOVE it :D
Lush have amazing cosmetics that are a godsend. 
It works really well and helped me a lot! smells soooo good and the exfoliator gets rid of all dead skin cells and keeps it all fresh. Keep it in the fridge also.
One of my favourite masks by them. Great for spots :D



</answer>

well they say that garlic wrks for makin nails strong n help them grow as well n well it does wrk but makes ur hands smell lol

<answer>



a package of  KNOX unflavored gelatin in a glass of water once a week. avoid painting your nails,  nails are hard skin cells, skin cells have to breathe, when you clog the airways of the skin it gets weak, just like make up, if you are one that doesnt wear make up or very light make up,  and one day you put on foundation that you normally wouldn't wear,  how does it make your face feel, like its sealed in rubber or plastic. same goes for salon, acrylic nails, have you seen the damage left behind from those things.  sorry for such and extended example hope some of this is of help, the knox gelatin works even with the smothering polishes. LOL, have a nice day

</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



omg, NO, it's not
abercrombie is such a cheap brand, and it's so overused and EVERYONE wears it, it's so boring & old now. not to mention that all their clothes always look the same all season.
i use to wear that stuff for 4 years, and it got boring, and i was even going to start working at hollister.

the pay is minimum wage, and the hours suck. most times you have to call in and ask. they over hire, and they fire alot for fresh new faces. they discriminate against workers, even though they don't want to admit it, they hire pretty, skinny people. it isn't worth working there. if you have a brain & talent, work somewhere else!

<category>



Beauty & Style



Other - Beauty & Style



</category>



<question from>



Oll M
Member since: 29 June 2007
Total points: 106 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Fake tan only works at first attempt...?



I have applied many a fake tan to my face and for the first few times it works brilliantly...I look so bronzed. After that tho it gradually does nothing and while I never return to being pale I never reach a great level of tan.

Is it to do with moisture in my face?



</question>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



You could try a different type you can get mousse one's and wipes too. It could be because your skin has got used to it i dont think its anything to do with the moisture in your face maybe try get a darker one. Or put abit more on a couple of hours later xx



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



Yes I believe so... I use fake tanning lotions and stuff all the time and sometimes I just don't get tan at all, and other I turn bright orange. I've figured that what best works is to first take a warm shower, then tap my face (or legs) dry and apply the bronzer 15 minutes before going to bed. The next day you'll definitely see changes, and the tan will last longer (for me at least). maybe because when you sleep your skin is less stressed and is most likely going to absorb anything you apply to it then. 
Anyway, hope this helps!



</answer>

<question>



Ladies what are your beauty tips what makes u feel and look more attractive?



come on dish the dirt LOl i love my false eyelashes on a night out,and  benefit leg shine 2 make your legs look moisturised x

<answer from>



scouse princess
Member since: 01 November 2007
Total points: 2540 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Exfoliator and moisturiser are essential- love Soap and Glory products :)
Intensive conditioner on hair at least once a week. (keeps it in tiptop condition)
Self heating Clay face masks (they feel amazing and do wonders for your skin), you can get them for 99p in Boots
Mascara- the most amazing beauty product ever created- particularly Dior Show
Lipgloss- love it, especially Dior. Lancome and Yves Saint Laurent ones
Fake tan (a good one, to accentuate my tan- one thats not cheap and nasty)
Burts Beeswax lipbalm, makes your lips all tingly :)
Sorry theres just loads.lol I will stop now xx



</answer>

Okay so this guy he isnt neccesarily my boyfriend because we live over 200 miles away from each other but we met at this camp thingy, fell in love and he told me he cant spend another day away from me even though its been a week since we left the camp and he is coming to my hometown to see me anyway...I invited him to stay at my house and my mom being the strict german she is only let him sleep in my bed in my bedroom and I have to sleep on the floor in my sisters bedroom! to be honest my bedroom is a dump and its so plain...what can I do that would impress him or a question to guys when you see a girls bedroom what impresses you? Angel

<answer>

Nick N

</answer from>



<answer>



Several points and I talk from experience. If you feel self concious then do something about it. Also your smile is very important to your confidence and if your "friend" is being like that then dump her. A true best friend would never be able to see any faults like that!

You do appear to have an overbite but is is not ugly and I would not feel bad about it if I were you. Your teeth are straight and nicely aligned. When I was 28 my wisdom teeth came through and made my already crowed mouth even more crowded. I was self concious and went to see an orthadontist. I wore a brace for 2 years (there was a lot of work to do) and now I have very good teeth. (Now it is possible to get braces that fit to the back of the teeth and are invisible to others. A good orthadontist will give you a new bite and bring your lower teeth out)

I found that using the new sonic toothbrushes (Braun) made a big difference and made my teeth whiter. I would reccomend it to everyone.



</answer>

Okay well you should  not of shaven your eyebrows they will just come back thicker and darker and possably ingrowing ones may appear. 
Untill you can pluck them again just draw them on with eyeliner and brow pencils that you can buy from cosmetic shops, just untill they grow back then when they have you can pluck them normally.

<answer>



lol my eyelashes are normal size i think. They are not too long but not too short they are a little above medium :) but i like them to show as if they were really long :)

<answer from>



peace_da...
Member since: 16 June 2008
Total points: 489 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



1. Don't use mascara unless you need to, and always take it off at night.
2. Try to use a non-waterproof, unless you have very oily skin.
3. At night, put vasaline or castor oil on your eyelashes. Just a little does the trick. It will condition them and stop them from falling out, so they can grow longer and thicker and healthier.

Hope I helped!!!

oh yeah, and also remember to curl your eyelashes before and NOT AFTER applying mascara, or else they could break.
I'd reccomend any mascara by neutrogena. They have one made from olives that works well and is also really good for your eyelashes, lol.



</answer>



<answer from>
Member since: 03 September 2008
Total points: 416 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



other than mascara?
vasaline..

http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?...



</answer>



<answer from>



mizellie...
Member since: 11 September 2008
Total points: 186 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



I too have average length eye-lashes and what  I do to give the illusion of full, elegant lashes is:
1) Apply clear mascara first.(at least 2 strokes) Cover Girl Clear Mascara or Maybelline Great Lash Clear Mascara works nicely.

2) Then apply the darkest mascara you can find.( I personally find L'Oreal's Telescopic Mascara in Blackest Black outstanding. It's lightweight, non-clumpy and elongates the lashes.

3) After letting the mascara set and dry, you can always use a lash comb to remove any excess residue and Bam!  Hope I've helped.



</answer>



<answer from>



balkapow
Member since: 16 September 2008
Total points: 224 (Level 1)
