<answer>



Start off with a simple check list as follows;
Step1: Go on a girly shopping spree to your local shopping mall
Step2:Wear a lot of pink especially if your known for being a tomboy
Step3:Go to the cinema and watch a film all the girls are going mad about e.g Angus thongs and perfect snogging or Wild Child
Step4:Wear skirts a lot try to keep them short and show off those legs you've been hiding 
Step5:Flirt a lot around where you hang out if possible find the boy right for you
Step6:Search through your parents draw and slap bam on the fake tan
Step7:Wear a lot of make-up but not OTT
Step8:Get yourself a fashion idol e.g Colleen Rooney or Cheryl Cole
Step9:Last but not least go to your local newsagents and pick yourself up a couple of mags e.g Heat, Bliss, Sugar, Mizz, Now, O.K, Closer that sort of thing
xx



</answer>



<answer from>



Alice
Member since: 01 August 2007
Total points: 1543 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Talk girly: no rude words, swearing etc.

Walk girly: stand tall, chin up, stomach in, chest out, fluid/graceful  movements

Dress girly: wear brighter colours, fitted clothes, sparkles/ glitter, skirts, dresses, high heels

Bling girly: wear pretty jewellery, sparkly earrings, colourful bracelets

Look girly: wear make-up, get your eyebrows shaped, wax/shave, paint nails, style hair

Smell girly: wash everyday, wear deodorant, nice perfume, wash hair often



</answer>

<answer>



ino this sounds wierd but it does work x

<question from>



maxinne
Member since: 15 September 2008
Total points: 94 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



I lost my glue. and i don't have time to buy it. what kind of glue i can use to fake eyelashes?  ?



can i use the same glue that i used in my fingernails?



</question>



<answer from>



Sunni
Member since: 31 August 2008
Total points: 249 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



I have to disagree with the other answers.  Other glues not made specially for eyelashes can be dangerous.  You may not have a reaction, but they can be extremely harmful to your eyes over time and cause damage directly to your eye.  It is not worth the price of harming your eyesight to put on false eyelashes.  In the future, make sure you have an extra glue onhand just in case you loss one.  Go without the lashes until you get the proper glue for them.  Better to be safe and have your sight, then to be sorry and suffer later.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



thank you so much...



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



D L
Member since: 28 May 2008
Total points: 6638 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



you can use superglue but only the gel type. dont use nail glue it will pull your real lashes out.



</answer>



<answer from>



Poppy
Member since: 07 March 2008
Total points: 488 (Level 2)



</answer from>

<question>



Californian Spray Tan?



Has anyone tried the californian spray tan? i'm talking about in a salon, where you've been sprayed in the booth?

Really wana try it, but want to know the advantages and disadvantages...

Thanks ;)



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



Advantages: You get a fast, even, perfect looking tan.
Disadvantages: None really. I mean, you have to do it often to keep it up so it can get pricey but that's it!



</answer>

<answer>



You sound great, but tips are what you're asking for so tips I shall give! I know EXACTLY what you mean about looking young. I am 20 yrs, and nobody believes it when I first meet them. Oh, and with no make-up on, forget it! I look about 15 without it! But, you will love that you look young once you hit 30! Try wearing some powder that matches your tone (I personally don't like foundation), some blush, a little bit of eyeliner on your bottom lash, a soft lilac eyeshadow (looks great on people w/ brown eyes), and some volume mascara. Something as little as getting your eyebrows waxed can make a huge difference on your face! Try places like Love Culture and Forever 21 for clothing for a fair price. Good luck! xoxo



</answer>

<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



use eye liner around the eyes but not too much. practice for a light look that is natural yet makes the eyes appear larger. Kohl pencils are good but careful not to apply too much. It can be repaired with a cotton bud. At night use the thickening mascara for extra affect. There are lots of makeups that make the skin appear a more even colour and give it a velvety texture. Makeup sales have experimental products that you can try. Nothing too heavy or it will feel uncomfortable and look fake. Lip liner helps to outline the lips and apply a little lipstick inside the line. If too heavy can be blotted out a little with tissues. Applying makeup does take practice but it is well worth the extra trouble to obtain a glowing healthy natural look without skin imperfections and colour variations that sometimes appear (nose too red etc) 
With clothes go for the tailored clean look as you are short---- nothing frilly or too busy. You don't need a lot as better to have a smaller range but of good quality.



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



First of all if you want to look more your age, why not opt for a hairstyle around shoulder length.You can look at hairstyle books and choose the one you like that will accent your face shape.Make sure you shape your eyebrows.Go light on the makeup.If you dont know what's quite right for you remember you can type questions on the internet and match your body type with what's best for your body.When a person is short solid colors and same patterns are better as it doesnt "cut' the waistline making you appear shorter.Also, up and down stripes are best.stripes accross make you look shorter.You can usually get advice at clothing stores,by finding someone who is willing to help.I hope this helps.



</answer>

<question>



Can i make my nose higher?



is there any way to make my nose bridge higher..or make my nose a bit more better looking??....im asian and i have like no nose bridge lol...



</question>



<answer from>

<answer from>

</answer from>



<answer>

<answer from>



Farina
Member since: 02 May 2008
Total points: 3622 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



It's normal to want some changes on your physical appearance. I mean, when a white person has surgery to get rid of some of that nose bridge, nobody is telling her to "remember her ancestry" huh?

My advice to you is to take the first step: really examine the reasons WHY you want your nose higher. Don't just say "cos I don't like it"...You'll be surprised how many reasons there are, and if you can tackle the root cause of your insecurity, you may realize you don't need painful and risky plastic surgery at all.

Now if you're adamant about it and 100% sure you want something done, you can try those silicone injections (I'm not sure how you call it). You can search "nosejob without surgery" in youtube or Google and you should find some info on nosejobs that don't require surgery. Basically a doc can inject a substance in your nose (after numbing it of course) and "mold" a bridge for you using his fingers. This is a fairly new technique, less invasive, worth looking into if it's your first time and do not want to have actual surgery.

***

I should add, that new method may not give you obvious results. It may not be able to "raise" your nose bridge considerably..it's there to shape your nose and create an illusion of height or narrowness, not actually add height. Also, this is not permanent, it could last from a few months to couple years. Pls talk carefully with your surgeon abt this.

all the best.



</answer>

Esq.
Member since: 21 October 2006
Total points: 6202 (Level 5)

<question from>

</question from>



<question>



How can I make a solid perfume last longer?/stronger?



is there anyway of making it stronger/last longer, I know puttin it on your wrists helps spread the smell in general but spray perfumes seem so much stronger, thanks for any help



</question>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



well if you have a problem with solid perfumes strength, dont use it.
or use more.



Source(s):



answer my question? :)
http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index;...



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



spray some on your wrist and neck.[:
then use the same scent in body spray, and spray your body[:

http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?...



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



I use solid perfume for touch ups of my spray versions. i think they're mostly for convenience and layering with other scents.

apply it to your pulse points such as wrists, elbows, behind ears, throat etc and it might last a little longer. apply it to the back of your neck if you're wearing your hair down, the scent will transfer to your hair slightly too.
if you have dry skin, put vaseline or baby lotion on your skin before you put on perfume, it will help the perfume stick on your skin.



dont overdo the scent though! you dont want to drown in it! :)



</answer>

<question>



Herbal Essences? What did you think?



I recently purchased Herbal Essences Totally Twisted for curly/wavy hair. I was wondering, did it make any difference to y'alls hair? If so, how? And would you recommend it to others?



Thanks, your opinion/experiences are appreciated.



</question>



<answer from>



Julz C
Member since: 20 August 2008
Total points: 194 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



it smells fabulous, however,  the moisture one does more curling and leaves my frizzy dry & unmanageable hair feeling pretty good. my hair is naturally curly.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



I agree. It does smell delicious and I, too have naturally curly/wavy hair. It didn't make an impressive difference but I think it calmed the frizz down a notch and was better than the Palmolive stuff I used to use.



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Jessica!
Member since: 29 July 2008
Total points: 1253 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



i have really straight hair, but it just made it a little wavy(barely noticeable)



i wouldn't recommend it, but it does smell good!!



</answer>



<answer from>



ms_dr_he...
Member since: 04 November 2007
Total points: 3160 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



I've found it to dry out my hair, but leaving it with a delicious smell.

<question from>



emilee18...
Member since: 14 July 2008
Total points: 109 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



What should I wear to a wedding?



My boyfriend's friend is having a wedding on October 24th, and I was invited also. I have never really been to many weddings, only family, and I was able to ask them how to dress. But I don't really see my boyfriends friend and I have only met them a few times. The invitation is quite fancy (white with gold raised fancy writing, and a meal card and rsvp.) The wedding is in a church I think and the reception hall is large and beautiful (a real hall, not like a fire hall or anything). I am very unsure of what to wear. Please help! Thank you!!



</question>



<answer from>



chelsea
Member since: 14 July 2007
Total points: 7801 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Well if the invitation says formal or black tie, you'll need a floor length dress.



If it says semi-formal you should wear a cocktail dress.



If it doesn't say anything, go off of the time of the wedding. If it's a day wedding, a day dress would be fine. If it's in the evening, go with a cocktail dress or a top/skirt that looks like evening wear.



</answer>



<answer from>



LAUREN =]
Member since: 06 February 2008
Total points: 2883 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



wear a wedding dress.



that would be funny.



</answer>



<answer from>



Get Well Travis and Adam!!!
Member since: 01 June 2006
Total points: 1026 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Just pick a classic dress that is pretty neutral. Nothing in the colors of the wedding and def. not white or creamy. You can also wear a pant-suit that looks nice (not Clintonish) with a pretty top. But personally, I would go with a very nice looking dress that is quite long. Silver is also a good color or shades of brown. Compliment your boyfriend's outfit. Go with the same color scheme to coordinate as well. But go with a classic longer cut. Just a long as you nice and classy then you'll blend right in. Have fun!!!!



</answer>

<question>



When can a fabric with good balance in its thread count be unsatisfactory?



fabric



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



Some "high thread count" sheets can actually be from inferior cotton.

<question from>



Jaslury(...
Member since: 14 August 2008
Total points: 97 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Whats the difference between Acrylic Nails And Gel Nails ? ?



Im on a beauty therapy website and i want to no whats the difference between acrylic nails and Gel nails and what would be better for short nails for me to get?



</question>



<answer from>



WeeFee
Member since: 19 February 2007
Total points: 123 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Acrylics are ok but they make a mess of your natural nail as they're stuck on with super glue.



Gels on the other hand (no pun intended) let your nail breathe underneath, are very hardwearing, don't chip or crack like nail polish, and last for weeks. Try CalGel at a salon.



</answer>



<answer from>



mumma p
Member since: 30 May 2008
Total points: 1429 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



they are both good, but if you do a lot of cleaning or your hands are in water alot, I would suggest you get acrylic.
I have had both, and I am a hairdresser, the gel peeled off from my hands constantly in the water, but the acrylic is more damaging to your nail bed, as they file away the top layer..
Good luck



</answer>



<answer from>



arrr)
Member since: 23 September 2008
Total points: 94 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



They are both the same. I just got mine gel and there the same **** as acrylic except my gel were 45$ and my acrylic are usually 25$ Im pissed off.



</answer>

<question from>



bsbabypr...
Member since: 29 July 2008
Total points: 281 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



How do i get my freshly painted nails to stop chipping?



Ok i just painted my nails yesterday and i put 2 coats of color and 2 coats of top coat ( cuz 1 coat of top coat they were still chipping!). I washed dishes today and now every Single nail that i painted yesterday is chipped! What can i do to keep my painted nails from chipping! PLEASE HELP!



</question>



<answer from>



Oreo ♥
Member since: 12 December 2007
Total points: 557 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



You want to make sure your nails are smooth, clean and dry before you paint them.  So try lightly buffing your nails before you paint them.  Use thin coats.  The thicker it is the faster it will chip.  And if you are going to wash dishes you need to wear gloves.  Only use one coat of top coat then like every other day you can apply a new layer for about a week.



There are also products that say they prevent chipping. I know OPI has one.  IDK how well it works though.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Thanks! I hope this works i cant stand re painting my nails every other day!



</asker's comment>

<question>



What are some products that can make your skin smooth ?



</question>



<answer from>



mythicro...
Member since: 02 October 2007
Total points: 140 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>

<asker's comment>



Thanks



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Rori G
Member since: 01 October 2008
Total points: 105 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Anything that is cantaining exfloiantion beads. They have bunch of exfolation scrubs at most grocery and beauty supplie stores. But you didn;t specify you face or body so i am going to include a bunch of home body/face exfolicating recipes. Enjoy!!!



Basic Oatmeal Facial Scrub



Ingredients



2 teaspoons ground oatmeal



1 teaspoon baking soda



water



Instructions



Combine oatmeal and bakind soda.



Stir until well mixed.



Add water, mere drops at a time, stirring until a paste forms.



Apply to face, gently rubbing in a circular motion.



Rinse well.



Pat dry.



Sweet Oatmeal Facial Scrub



Ingredients
2 tablespoons finely ground oatmeal



2 tablespoons granulated sugar



2 tablespoons brown sugar



1/2 cup vegetable or almond oil (almond is best)



1 teaspoon nutmeg



Instructions
Combine all ingredients.



Mix well.



Apply to wet face, rubbing gently.



Rinse well.



Pat dry.



Sugar Spa Body Scrub



Ingredients
1 cup granulated sugar



1/2 cup oil (almond is best, but any vegetable oil may be used)



fragrance, if desired



Instructions
Mix the sugar and oil until well blended.



Add 10 to 15 drops of essential oil for fragrance, if desired.



Apply the mix to wet skin with hands, washcloth, loofah, sponge, or bath glove, gently rubbing in a circular manner.



Rinse well.



Salt Body Scrub



Ingredients
1/2 cup (sea salt is best)



1/2 cup vegetable oil (preferably almond)



fragrance, if desired



Instructions



Mix the salt and vegetable oil until well blended.



Stir in 10 to 15 drops of essential oil if fragrance is desired.



Important Note About Exfoliating



While exfoliating can be an excellent addition to your beauty regimen, there are also times you shouldn't exfoliate. For example, if you have an undiagnosed skin rash or condition, please check with your doctor for diagnosis and treatment, since exfoliation can actually aggravate some skin conditions. Additionally,



you should not exfoliate:



skin with cuts



broken skin



sunburned skin



Source(s):



Lovetoknow.com



</answer>

<question from>



Candy-Gi...
Member since: 27 June 2008
Total points: 280 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Should i use hot water or acetone to remove my fake nails?



some tell me hot water others tell me acetone so...what should i use?



</question>



<answer from>



BARBIE
Member since: 26 April 2008
Total points: 236 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



use warm water, and after all over, apply some cream on the remaining skin, it works goods! :)



</answer>



<answer from>



nichola_...
Member since: 15 March 2007
Total points: 371 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Your going to be there for a long time if you just use hot water hun! Do you have acrylic nails on that were applied by a nail techician? Gel nails? Or stick on ones, you did yourself? Ideally you should visit your nail technician to take them off, but I know this isnt always ideal. So get yourself some acetone and soak your tips in there for as long as you need to this can take upto half an hour. Dont try to pull them away from your nail bed as you will take off layers and be left with soft weak nails. You can use and orange stick to scrape off any soft top layer once you have soaked them for a while. It also makes it easier if you flie your nails right down, then there is less to soak off.
Once you are done dont forget to treat your nails to some moisturiser and if you have one a calcium treatment topcoat!



Good Luck it does take some time, but its better than broken nails!



Source(s):



Nail technician



</answer>



<answer from>



Lindsey ♥ {Lou.)
Member since: 18 January 2008
Total points: 18551 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Celebrities



Hair



</answer from>



<answer>



Soak them in Acetone for 10-15 minutes, maybe a little longer, Then nail should soften and you can lift up,or push the softened nail off, with something like a orangewood stick.



Source(s):



Milady book.



</answer>

<question>



Heading into the real world wearing...what?



I am going to be graduating with a degree in psychology this December meaning that I'm going to have to start going to interviews to get a real job. I understand what appropriate work clothes are but what should I be wearing keeping in mind that I need to make people feel comfortable talking to me. I don't want to be overdressed but if I'm under-dressed then I won't be seen as a professional. What do you think? What would you like to see a counselor wear? Any other information like things to avoid, tips, good colors etc. would be very helpful. Thank you!



</question>

Kitloves...
Member since: 11 August 2008
Total points: 391 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



really nice black trousers. find a pair you love.
a great material. and a cut that flatters your shape. they are a hugggee staple..
you can wear them with more casual but still work suitable knitwear. such as a jumper with a nice neckline/sleeve detail.
nothing low cut or short though :D



</answer>

Celebrities



Hair



</answer from>



<answer>



If your hair is getting greasy afte 2 days, Try washing it every other day...If your hair is getting greasy by the end of the first day you wash it, Wash your hair everyday, and use a Shampoo for Oily hair..ALWAYS condition it though.



Just to make clear:
If you wash your haireveryday, when you have naturally dry hair, You will wash the natural oils out of your hair, which makes your hair dry and frizzy.



If you have naturally oily hair, Shampoo will not strip the oils out of your hair, because your hair produces too much oil for it all to be washed out, and nor will it make your hair more oily.



</answer>

when you wash your hair every day, it takes away the natural oils in your hair and it will make your hair dry for a little while, and then your scalp will try to make the oils again, and it will make your hair greasy. what i do is wash it every other day but beware, while you're changing your washing routines your hair will react, and it has to have about a week to get used to it.

<category>



Beauty & Style



Other - Beauty & Style



</category>



<question from>



♥bumbleb...
Member since: 08 June 2008
Total points: 15607 (Level 6)



</question from>



<question>



How bad does getting your eyebrow pierced hurt?



I was going to get it done 2 weeks ago. I did not because a family member was in the hospital. I have to wait until I'm 18(2months) I want the barbell not the ring.



1)how much does it hurt?
2)does it get infected really?



</question>



<answer from>



Master of the Magicians
Member since: 05 September 2007
Total points: 4429 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Religion & Spirituality



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



I just recently got out of that business so I might know a little about it.



It hurts a little but not as bad as a bee sting, The needles that are used should be sterile piercing needles which are designed for one use only. they are extremely sharp and they are hollow so they make a nice hole very easily.



Your jewelry should be made of solid gold or certified 316 LVM surgical steel or greater. You can usually tell by the price if the metal is good or not but not always, so ask because the biggest cause of infection is cheap jewelry. For an eyebrow ring, or a curve or straight barbell the gage should be 16 which is standard or if you want something big 14  is about as big as you should go for an eyebrow.



Eyebrows aren't usually that dangerous, but tongues and some other body parts have nerves that if you pierce the wrong place can paralyze your face or cause nerve damage! so it is a good idea to have a trained professional do your piercing, if you do it yourself know what you are doing first.



After you get it done it will be sore for about 3 days, it is best to just wash new piercings with soap and warm water 2 or 3 times a day for the first week and turn it when you clean it so it does not stick or form a scab, if the jewelry is high quality the chance of infection is low. some jobe will not let people wear body piercing so you might ask about a plastic retainer that you can wear if you have to take the jewelry out because eyebrow piercings close up much faster than pierced ears, they can close up in as little as a day in some people.



Hope this answers your question correctly!



Good luck!



Source(s):



MM



</answer>



<asker's comment>



ty



</asker's comment>

<question from>



Brianna

<answer from>

Member since: 21 August 2008
Total points: 971 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I cant paint my finger nails cause I chew all my nails off, so any color looks horrible on me. I would suggest for you to paint your nails a pastel color, or something not so bright. Bright colors make your nails, and hands, look a lot larger than they really are. Try a pearly color, kinda off white and with some great shimmer, and the monochrome look (changes colors when you move it in light). Other than that I cant think of anything else. Just be sure to stay away from neon colors!



</answer>

<answer>



I'd say I'm low maintenance when it comes to looking good.  I splash out on a manicure every few weeks,I  like nice clothes and good shoes, I moisturise every day -  but  I feel it is more important to feel confident in your skin, and from that you look good naturally.



Some women seem to spend hours and hours doing themselves up to look worse, or no different.



Having said all that it is great, and almost necessary for me as a woman, to be complimented.  I don't know why I need this, my logic tells me its not important but my female hormones take over and nearly demand it.



</answer>

<answer from>



emma
Member since: 13 May 2008
Total points: 1847 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Well, I'm 35 now.  My feelings have changes so much since I was a teen.  When I was a teen, I was obsessed with looking good.  I spent at least an hour and a half getting ready for school in the morning and more if going out.



I was very attractive though.  I'd worry about one little pimple like it was the end of the world.  I had to have all the right clothes.  This continued on into my 20's but now things have changed.  I now worry about "Do I look old?" all the time!  Body wise, I look more like 25 but my skin is starting to make me look older because I spent way too many hours in the sun or in the tanning beds.



I'm not as worried now though about how I look when I go out.



</answer>
